description.narrative: At the Project level, the Project is expected to: (i) support the development of Environmental and Social ("E&S") initiatives across AC Health Group's investment portfolio in the Philippines; and (ii) create positive stakeholder and environmental effects. At the Market level, the Project will contribute to improved financial market integration by introducing the first social bond issuance in the Philippine real sector. The proposed Social Bond will provide a benchmark for similar issuances, and therefore, promote strengthened standards.

Headquartered in Makati City, Philippines, Ayala Healthcare Holdings, Inc. (AC Health or the Company together with its the AC Health Subsidiaries, namely, HMC, Inc. doing business under the name and style of Healthway Medical (Healthway) and Zodiac Health Ventures, Inc. (the Cancer Hospital) shall be referred to as the AC Health Group) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ayala Corporation which is engaged in healthcare investments. Since 2015, the Company has invested in pharmacies, clinics, hospitals, as well as health technology, with an aim to address the unmet need for accessible, affordable and quality healthcare for all Filipinos. The Company is planning to expand the footprint of Healthways primary care and multi-specialty clinics and to establish and develop a new cancer hospital; and Ayala Corporation (AC or the Sponsor) plans to refinance its investments in the Healthways primary care and multi-specialty clinics and in the Cancer Hospital and to support the AC Health Subsidiaries technology initiatives (the Project).
